intro: Lunathyrium orientale var. jiulungense, commonly known as the Jiulung mountain bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
